intro: Dicalix wangii, commonly known as the Wang's dicalix, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its blooming period occurs in late spring, producing clusters of white and pink flowers that attract pollinators. Due to habitat loss, Dicalix wangii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
